products.title: april x Iznik Mavi Cini – Cup
products.body_html:
Material: Ceramic 

Capacity: 60g (H 6,5cm x W 6cm)

Made in Turkey. 

About the material:

These special coffee cups and mugs are handcrafted in Iznik, Turkey, using traditional techniques and a unique formula. Iznik ceramics first began production in the mid-14th century during the Ottoman Empire, reaching their golden age in the 16th and 17th centuries. The most distinctive feature of Iznik ceramics is that they contain 85% quartz, a semiprecious mineral. Quartz is considered one of the most challenging minerals to process in ceramic literature, which is why only a few manufacturers worldwide can work with it.

These cups are entirely handcrafted, from the production of the ceramic body to the intricate patterns featuring green and orange colors. They are not subjected to any machine or mass production processes.

About Iznik Mavi Cini:

Established in 2002 with the aim of realising traditional Iznik tiles, whose production ended in the 18th century and remained silent until the 21st century, with today's technology. With continuous R&D studies and design power, Iznik Mavi CIni works to prevent there exquisite works of art from going into oblivion, seeks to introduce them to new generations and transferred to future generations. This tile, handmade by Iznik Mavi Cini, is an antique artifact of the future.

 

IZNIK GUIDELINES AND CERTIFICATIONS

products.title: april x Iznik Mavi Cini – Mug
products.body_html:
Material: Ceramic (Iznik Tile)

Capacity: 250g (H 11cm x W 8cm)

Made in Turkey. 

About the material:

This Mug is handcrafted in Iznik, Turkey, using traditional techniques and a unique formula. Iznik ceramics first began production in the mid-14th century during the Ottoman Empire, reaching their golden age in the 16th and 17th centuries. The most distinctive feature of Iznik ceramics is that they contain 85% quartz, a semiprecious mineral. Quartz is considered one of the most challenging minerals to process in ceramic literature, which is why only a few manufacturers worldwide can work with it.

These cups are entirely handcrafted, from the production of the ceramic body to the intricate patterns featuring green and orange colors. They are not subjected to any machine or mass production processes. 

 

About Iznik Mavi Cini:

Established in 2002 with the aim of realising traditional Iznik tiles, whose production ended in the 18th century and remained silent until the 21st century, with today's technology. With continuous R&D studies and design power, Iznik Mavi CIni works to prevent there exquisite works of art from going into oblivion, seeks to introduce them to new generations and transferred to future generations. This tile, handmade by Iznik Mavi Cini, is an antique artifact of the future.

products.title: April Hybrid Brewer
products.body_html:
The Hybrid brewer will be back in stock February 2025.

We have taken the April Glass Brewer and added an Immersion function, which we call Hybrid, that allows you to control the flow rate of your brewers. This is the final version, and it will exclusively be available in orange. 

Material: Glass, Silicone, Plastic, and Metal.
Style: Flatbed
Color: Orange, Dark Green & Transparent Glass
Paper filter: April x Sibarist or April Large Paper Filter

products.body_html:
Farm: Kamavindi Estate
Producer: Peter Mbature
Region: Embu, Kenya
Varietal: SL28, SL34, Ruiru 11, Batian (AB)
Processing: Washed

Peter is producing several varietals familiar to buyers of Kenyan coffee, from SL28 to Ruiru 11, but he is also proudly farming 300 Gesha trees on his estate in Embu. He operates his own wet and dry processing. 

Flavor notes: Blackberries, Red Apple & Florals

products.title: April x Sibarist Paper filters
products.body_html:
The Paper Filter you use when brewing coffee makes a difference and we are always curious to see how we can increase the stylistic range of the coffees we brew with the April Brewers.

The main adaptation for these is for the April Hybrid (releasing in November) and the April Plastic Brewers. 

This is paper filter that allows for a finer grind size and a different pouring structure than what we usually do. Hence, the April Brewers just got a lot more dynamic to brew with. 

 

One pack contains 50 filters.

products.title: April Organic Subscription
products.body_html:
Before you Subscribe please note that regardless of when you subscribe you will be charged again on the 15th. So, if you want to avoid to be charged twice in your first month. Please place your order after the 15th. 

Roast Profile: Light/Medium 

This is the perfect option for those of you that want to enjoy the comfort of a really good organic lot every month. You will get a shipment of freshly roasted coffee from our organic partners. 

This Subscription is not focusing on different coffees every month. We have a longterm perspective and as our Organic Coffee line grows you will see a wider range of coffees but until then you might get the same coffee sent to you every month.

The roast is medium, which gives the coffee a balanced taste experience. Allowing for a low acidity with emphasis on sweetness and clear flavor notes.

To manage your subscription, log in to your account. Or create an account.

 

Roasted Coffee Beans (Ristede hele kaffebønner)
